conclusion: To determine where liquid will flow into containers E, F, or G after passing through the baffles located at A, B, C, and D, we need to analyze the paths of each liquid flow based on the baffles' positioning.
Liquid A is flowing from the top left corner toward the right.
Liquid B is flowing from the top center.
Liquid C is flowing from the top right corner.
Liquid D is flowing from the top far right.
Liquid A flows downward and to the right due to the blue baffle placed below it, then continues straight as there is no more obstacle in its path until it reaches container E.
Liquid B flows downward and to the right but is stopped by the green baffle placed below it, causing it to turn left and flow into container F.
Liquid C flows downward and to the right but is stopped by the red baffle above it, causing it to turn left and flow into container G.
Liquid D flows downward and to the right but is intercepted by the orange baffle above it, causing it to turn left and flow into container E.
Container E receives liquids A and D.
Final answer: Container E will receive liquids A and D, container F will receive liquid B, and container G will receive liquid C.
